IMUSim
Package imusim :: Package platforms :: Module gyroscopes :: Class ADXRS300

Class ADXRS300

source code

Model of the Analog devices ADXRS300 gyroscope with enhanced range.

For range extension method see Analog Devices application note AN625.

The model assumes that the output of the gyroscope is converted to a 3.3V voltage domain using a 1% tolerance resistor divider.

Method Details

__init__(self, platform, noiseStdDev, sensitivity='300deg/s', rng=None, **kwargs)
(Constructor)

source code 

Initialise sensor.

Parameters:
  • platform - Platform this sensor will be attached to.
  • positionOffset - Position offset vector of this sensor in the local co-ordinate frame of its host platform.
  • rotationOffset - Rotation offset quaternion of this sensor in the local co-ordinate frame of its host platform.
  • sensitivity - Sensitivity, '300deg/s', '600deg/s', '900deg/s' or '1200deg/s'.
  • noiseStdDev - Standard deviation of measured output voltage noise in the system in which the gyroscope is integrated.
  • rng - np.random.RandomState from which to draw imperfections.
Decorators:
  • @prepend_method_doc(Gyroscope)
Overrides: object.__init__

sensedVoltages(self, t)

source code 

Get output voltages at given times.

This function should include all deterministic effects in the sensor, but not random noise.

Parameters:
  • t - time(s) at which to measure.
Returns:
3xN np.ndarray of output voltages, where N = len(t).
Overrides: sensors.Sensor.sensedVoltages
